meanings.sent1: The rock was nonconvertible into a liquid state.
meanings.sent2: The toy car was nonconvertible into a real vehicle.
meanings.sent3: The idea of flying without wings is as nonconvertible as a fish riding a bicycle.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness was as nonconvertible as a brick wall.
meanings.sent5: The concept of time travel remained nonconvertible in their minds.

meanings.definition: Not able to be changed into another form.
meanings.sent1: The solid ice was nonconvertible into a gas.
meanings.sent2: The painting was nonconvertible into a sculpture.
meanings.sent3: Trying to turn a cat into a dog is as nonconvertible as turning night into day.
meanings.sent4: His determination was as nonconvertible as a diamond.
meanings.sent5: The secret code remained nonconvertible, puzzling even the experts.

meanings.sent1: The local currency was nonconvertible in the foreign market.
meanings.sent2: The antique coins were nonconvertible for modern money.
meanings.sent3: Trying to trade sand for gold is as nonconvertible as trading a smile for a frown.
meanings.sent4: Her loyalty was as nonconvertible as a rare gem.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was nonconvertible, holding historical value beyond measure.
